intro: Arisarum vulgare var. clusii, commonly known as the clustered arum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It features a short, rhizomatous stem and produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers surrounded by a showy, green spathe. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often mottled with white or yellow markings. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The botanical characteristics of this variety make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens with suitable conditions.
